alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 2:11PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Laurel, southwestern Bell, western Knox, southeastern Pulaski, McCreary and Whitley Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 210 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Alpine to near Strunk. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Honeybee around 215 PM EDT. Huxley, Ayers, Zion Hill and Duckrun around 220 PM EDT. Jellico Creek, Baldrock, Rockcastle Springs, Bounty, Bark Camp and Krupp around 225 PM EDT. Holly Bay Rec. Area, Emlyn, Bon, Pleasant View, Mountain Ash, Grove, Redbird, Saxton, Rye and Red Ash around 230 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Williamsburg, Hightop, Yaden, Suttons Mill, Keavy, Vox, Wofford, Packard, Goldbug, Barton, Julip, Lucky, Verne, Dixie, Perkins, Dorthae, Nevisdale, North Corbin, Gatliff, Polly Camp, London, Louden, Gausdale, Fariston, Lily, London-Corbin Airport, Levi Jackson S.P., Sublimity City, Carpenter and Clate. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
